channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024021464
item.description:
Report X-2024021464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 1 X 20 liter plastic bottle of hydrochloric acid. 20 Liter plastic bottle of hydrochloric acid had a loose cap allowing .25 liters to release. No slotted partitions or absorbent found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 X 20 liter bottle had a loose lid leaking out .25 liters of hydrochloric acid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024021164
item.description:
Report X-2024021164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged hazmat was brought to QA. At first glance, there was a medium size wet spot on the body of the box near the top. Grabbed my PPE to inspect the damage. DescribePack: The wet spot on the inside of the box crystallized as well as on the outside of the bottle where the leak was coming from. The cap was not completely secured on the bottle. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Kept the package upright to prevent any more leaks.

Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 x 5-gallon plastic bottle of decons ethanol 190 proof had a loose cap / lid released all contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1950 Aerosols, flammable UN1950 Aerosols, flammable Class 2.1 Class 2.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging (if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging (if any): Packaging Type: Receptacle Packaging Type: Receptacle Material of Construction: Metal Material of Construction: Metal Package Capacity: 170 g Package Capacity: 184 g Amount in Package: 170 g Amount in Package: 184 g Number in Shipment: 2 Number in Shipment: 3 Number Failed: 2 Number Failed: 3

item.title: Report E-2024020467
item.description:
Report E-2024020467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN1307 Unisol Liquid Red B-75 release from a 350-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote body. The crew confirmed the tote lid appear to be damaged by freight falling onto the lid. All free liquid was wiped off the damaged tote with absorbent pads and placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The tote was staged onsite pending a new lid from the shipper. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

THE PAINT WAS PLACED IN A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM AND PUT IN THE CAGE DescribePack: BOTH CANS HAD LOOSE LIDS CAUSING PAINT TO LEAK OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN A SEALED DRUM AND PLACED IN HAZ CAGE

item.title: Report X-2024020803
item.description:
Report X-2024020803

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Received package from unload, noticed very strong gas odor. Checked the box for any signs of diamond labels or OP-900 labels. Upon not finding either, opened box to find two 2.5 Gallon containers labeled Kerosene. Immediately preformed damaged hazmat protocol for an undeclared hazmat. DescribePack: Loose cap on one container caused minimal amount of leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tightened cap on bottle.
